abstract: Look at the shares of the nation’s 10th-largest seller of residential housing and you might think that the real estate bubble never popped.
snippet: Look at the shares of the nation’s 10th-largest seller of residential housing and you might think that the real estate bubble never popped.
lead_paragraph: LOOK at the shares of NVR Inc., the parent of Ryan Homes, Fox Ridge Homes and NVHomes, and you might just think that the real estate bubble never popped. The nation’s 10th-largest seller of residential housing, NVR has generated stock gains of 21 percent so far this year. Its seven largest peers — including D. R. Horton, Toll Brothers, the Lennar Corporation and KB Home — have posted losses ranging from 5.3 percent to 18.5 percent this year.
